title: SUTA-LM: Bridging Test-Time Adaptation and Language Model Rescoring for Robust ASR
author: Wei-Ping Huang (National Taiwan University), Guan-Ting Lin (National Taiwan University), Hung-yi Lee (National Taiwan University), ...
relevance_why: This paper focuses on improving robustness in Automatic Speech Recognition (ASR) systems, which aligns with Haohe Liu's research interests in audio and speech processing, especially in handling real-world variabilities that can degrade model performance.
background: Test-Time Adaptation (TTA) adjusts model parameters during inference to mitigate performance drops due to domain shifts in ASR.
contribution: This paper introduces SUTA-LM, which combines TTA and language model rescoring to enhance the robustness of ASR systems, achieving significant reductions in word error rates across diverse datasets.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods often treat TTA and language model rescoring as separate processes, leading to inefficiencies and potential performance loss.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work synergizes TTA with linguistic adaptation through a novel auto-step selection mechanism, dynamically determining adaptation steps based on input characteristics.

key_innovation: The auto-step selection mechanism not only adjusts the number of adaptation steps but also incorporates both acoustic scores and linguistic confidence to select the optimal model for rescoring.
real_world_impact: The proposed method can significantly improve the performance of ASR systems in real-world applications, enhancing their usability in diverse acoustic environments.
limitations: The paper does not mention specific limitations, although the necessity for careful tuning of thresholds and parameters may impact generalization to unseen environments.

new_terms.Test-Time Adaptation (TTA): **Test-Time Adaptation (TTA)** refers to the ability of a machine learning model to adapt to new, unseen data distributions during inference, without additional training data.
new_terms.auto-step selection mechanism: **Auto-step selection mechanism** is a process that dynamically determines the optimal number of adaptation steps during inference, based on acoustic and linguistic information.

open_sourcing: The source code is available at https://github.com/hhhaaahhhaa/ASR-TTA
